meanings.definition: Opposed to academic pursuits or values.
meanings.sent1: Her antiacademic attitude towards studying often led to conflicts with her teachers.
meanings.sent2: The professor found his antiacademic views on research methods quite unconventional.
meanings.sent3: Despite his antiacademic stance, he still managed to excel in practical skills.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork was a rebellion against the traditional, antiacademic style of painting.
meanings.sent5: The student's antiacademic behavior in class made it challenging for others to focus.

meanings.definition: A person who is against academic institutions or practices.
meanings.sent1: As an antiacademic, he believed that real-world experience was more valuable than formal education.
meanings.sent2: The group of antiacademics protested against the strict policies of the university.
meanings.sent3: The antiacademic's unconventional approach to learning often raised eyebrows among his peers.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the rebel antiacademic who challenged the norms of the educational system.
meanings.sent5: The antiacademic's passion for self-directed learning inspired others to think outside the box.
